intro: Freesia leichtlinii subsp. alba, commonly known as the white freesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features strap-like, grassy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its bloom period usually occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate and aromatic touch to landscapes.
